adventLectionary.title: Jesus comes to bear witness to the truth
adventLectionary.html:
Joh 8:31-36; 14:15-17a; 16:12-15; 18:33-38

831Jesus said to the people who believed in him, 

jesus

“You are truly my disciples if you remain faithful to my teachings. 32And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”

the crowd

33“But we are descendants of Abraham,”

they said.

the crowd

“We have never been slaves to anyone. What do you mean, ‘You will be set free’?”

34Jesus replied, 

jesus

“I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave of sin. 35A slave is not a permanent member of the family, but a son is part of the family forever. 36So if the Son sets you free, you are truly free.

...

jesus

1415“If you love me, obey* my commandments. 16And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate,* who will never leave you. 17aHe is the Holy Spirit, who leads into all truth. The world cannot receive him, because it isn’t looking for him and doesn’t recognize him.

...

jesus

1612“There is so much more I want to tell you, but you can’t bear it now. 13When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak on his own but will tell you what he has heard. He will tell you about the future. 14He will bring me glory by telling you whatever he receives from me. 15All that belongs to the Father is mine; this is why I said, ‘The Spirit will tell you whatever he receives from me.’

...

1833Then Pilate went back into his headquarters and called for Jesus to be brought to him.

Pontius Pilate

Are you the king of the Jews?

he asked him.

34Jesus replied, 

jesus

“Is this your own question, or did others tell you about me?”

Pontius pilate

35“Am I a Jew?”

Pilate retorted.

Pontius pilate

“Your own people and their leading priests brought you to me for trial. Why? What have you done?”

36Jesus answered, 

jesus

“My Kingdom is not an earthly kingdom. If it were, my followers would fight to keep me from being handed over to the Jewish leaders. But my Kingdom is not of this world.”

37Pilate said,

Pontius pilate

“So you are a king?”

Jesus responded, 

jesus

“You say I am a king. Actually, I was born and came into the world to testify to the truth. All who love the truth recognize that what I say is true.”

Pontius pilate

38“What is truth?”

Pilate asked. Then he went out again to the people and told them,

Pontius pilate

He is not guilty of any crime.

Joh 14:15 Other manuscripts read you will obey; still others read you should obey.
Joh 14:16 Or Comforter, or Encourager, or Counselor. Greek reads Paraclete; also in 14:26.
adventLectionary.Question1: With which character do you most identify in this story ? Why?
adventLectionary.Question2: What strengths and/or weaknesses do you see in this character?
adventLectionary.Question3: What do you think God was wanting your selected character to learn?
adventLectionary.Question4: What do you think God is wanting you to learn through this story? How can you cooperate with his good purposes today?
